Based on real world uses: https://github.com/huacnlee/zed/pull/3/

candidates.title: Introduced the `minify_key` feature for `i18n!` and added support for format specifiers in `t!`
candidates.body:
# What's New:

- Added a new `minify_key` attribute to the `i18n!` macro to support short hashed keys, optimizing memory usage and lookup speed.

```rust
// Enable short hashed keys using the default options.
i18n!("locales", minify_key = true);

// Enable short hashed keys using custom options.
i18n!("locales",
      minify_key = true,
      minify_key_len = 12,
      minify_key_prefix = "t_",
      minify_key_thresh = 64
);
```

- Added a new `metadata` attribute to the `i18n!` macro to load configuration from the `[package.metadata.i18n]` section in `Cargo.toml`, similar to `rust-i18n-cli`.

```rust
i8n!(metadata = true);
```

- Added support for format specifiers in the `t!` macro. You can now use [`std::fmt`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/fmt/) syntax to format variables.

```rust
t!("Hello, %{name}, you serial number is: %{sn}", name = "Jason", sn = 123 : {:08});
// => "Hello, Jason, you serial number is: 000000123"
```

- Add `tkv!` macro to generates a translation key and corresponding value pair from a given input value.


- Added `-t` option to `rust-i18n-cli` to manually add a translation to the localization file.

```bash
# Manually add a translation to the localization file.
$ cargo i18n -t "Hello, world!"

# Or provide a translated message
$ cargo i18n -t "Hello, world! => Hola, world!"
```
- Added the `log-miss-tr` feature to log missing translations at the warning level. This feature requires the `log` crate.

```log
[2024-01-28T08:42:47Z WARN  rust-i18n] missing: T.V1OgaWWKTAtfIo23z0g24 => "Zero padded number: %{count}" @ examples\app-minify-key\src\main.rs:54
```

candidates.title: Use `arc_swap` to implement `AtomicStr`
candidates.body:
The previous implementation allowed use-after-free in a multi-threaded context. This PR fixes the problem by using `ArcSwap`, which is implements thread-safe swapping of `Arc`s, and is widely used.

Resolves <https://github.com/longbridgeapp/rust-i18n/pull/71>.

candidates.title: Add chained fallback support and performance improved
candidates.body:
# New:
- Add more than one fallback with priority support, eg: `i18n!("locales", fallback = ["en", "es]);` 
  - #40
# Improved:
- Remove `RwLock` from `locale()` and `set_locale()`.
- String patterns replacement, time reduce 10% ~ 80%.
- Reduce memory copy on `t!()`.
# Breaking Changes:
- `rust_i18n::locale() -> String` => `rust_i18n::locale() -> Arc<String>` .
- `t!() -> String` => `t!() -> Cow<str>`.

candidates.title: Feat split carg i18n to separate crate
candidates.body:
Implements issue #45 (separating cli tool to separate crate)

Also other fixes in here includes
- updating some packages for the cli tool (itertools and clap)
- correcting edition of main top-level crate to 2021
- adjust all doc examples to compile (as several were incorrect)
- fix relative paths to rust-i18n for examples so `cargo outdated` works

candidates.title: Some more fixes and improvements.
candidates.body:
So I looked a bit into why "cargo i18n" wasn't working for me. Turns out it was because when given to load_locales, the path ended up looking like "././locales", which then confused globwalk, so it couldn't find anything. I tried fixing that by normalizing the path before giving it to globwalk. (I added normpath module because the standard canonicalize has some issues like mentioned in the normpath page: https://docs.rs/normpath/latest/normpath/ ) I looked a bit into adding a pull request to globwalk too, but it's using some other stuff for it and that rabbit hole started becoming pretty deep.

As a side note, I'm on Windows, so if it's been working for you, that might be why.

I added a test for the load_locales as well, which would've found out the bug for me.

I also removed some tests that I don't think should've been working? Like i18n!() should default to "locales", but that doesn't exist, and it should be "tests/locales" instead.

I also added sealed_test to dev-dependencies, so that I could just run "cargo test" multi-threadedly as is default. I think/hope the only non-thread-safe part is changing the locale, but it still feels a bit spooky, and might be a good idea to make it properly thread-safe at some point, or at least mention thread-safety. I didn't start doing that because I'm not entirely sure what is the goal of the thing.

I apologize if there is any non-rusty code or obvious mistakes, I just started learning yesterday and I was literally on chapter 2 of the book The Rust Programming Language, when I got a bit sidetracked.

candidates.title: Add to support translated text with multiple locales in one file.
candidates.body:
Fix #49

- Add to support translated text with multiple locales.
- Add `_version` for locale file for special the file format.
  - `_version: 1` - Split each language into difference files (default).
  - `_version: 2` - All language in same file.

## Example

```yml
# app.yml
_version: 2
hello:
  en: "Hello"
  zh-CN: "你好"
  world:
    en: "Hello World"
    zh-CN: "你好世界"
welcome.message:
  en: "Welcome"
  zh-CN: "欢迎"
```

Or old version:

```yml
# app.en.yml
_version: 1
hello: "Hello"
hello.world: "Hello World"
welcome.message: "Welcome"
```

```yml
# app.zh-CN.yml
_version: 1
hello: "你好"
hello.world: "你好世界"
welcome.message: "欢迎"
```

## Screenshot

![rust-i18n-example](https://github.com/longbridgeapp/rust-i18n/assets/5518/7b6cf058-7ef4-4ec7-8dea-0aa3619ce6eb)

candidates.title: Add Backend design, allows to custom backend.
feat: use once_cell instead of lazy_static
candidates.body:
使用 once_cell 代替 lazy_static 

1. [less macro, faster compiles](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=24672238)
2. [The once_cell API is currently being incorporated into the stdlib, easily adapt stdlib](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/74465)

candidates.title: Add extract command for find and extract incomplete translation into YAML
Load locales by manually
candidates.body:
For fix use I18n in deep dependencies

```
rust-i18n
  Cargo.toml
  src/lib.rs
  build.rs

// deps: rust-i18n
foo
  Cargo.toml
  src/lib.rs

// deps: rust-i18n, foo
bar
  Cargo.toml
  src/lib.rs
```

Usage:

```toml
[dependencies]
lazy_static = "1.4.0"
rust-i18n = "0"
```


Load macro and init translations in `lib.rs`

```rs
// Load I18n macro, for allow you use `t!` macro in anywhere.
#[macro_use]
extern crate rust_i18n;

// Init translations for current crate.
i18n!("./locales");
```
